[Fred Dello Russo]: All those in favor?

[Fred Dello Russo]: All those opposed?

[Fred Dello Russo]: Motion carries.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Communications from the Mayor to the Honorable President, to members of the Medford City Council,

[Fred Dello Russo]: City Hall, Medford, Massachusetts.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Dear Mr. President and councilors, I respectfully request and recommend that your honorable body approve the following amendments to revised ordinances entitled compensation plan and leave ordinances chapter 66 personnel.

[Fred Dello Russo]: City Medford amended in revised ordinances, compensation plan and leave ordinances chapter 66 personnel be it ordained by the Medford city council that chapter 66 entitled personnel article two entitled

[Fred Dello Russo]: classification and compensation plans.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Section 66.40 entitled public safety personnel is hereby amended as follows.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Section one and subsection 66.40 effective January 1st, 2014 at 2% of the present amount of each step within the grade shown below to set a present amount of each step and adjust the sum of thus obtained to the nearest and highest figure for the following grade.

[Fred Dello Russo]: public safety one, firefighter, public safety two, fire lieutenant, public safety three, fire captain, public safety four, fire deputy, public safety five, chief, section two and subsection 66.40, effective January 1st, 2015, add 2% of the present amount of each step within the grade shown below to the said present amount of each step and adjust the sum thus obtained

[Fred Dello Russo]: to the nearest and highest figure of the following grade, public safety, one firefighter, public safety, two fire lieutenant, public safety, three fire captain, public safety, four fire deputy chief, public safety, five chief section three subsection 66.4 effective January 1st, 2016 at 2% of the present amount of each step within the grade shown below to the set present amount of each step and adjust the sum thus obtained to the nearest and highest figure

[Fred Dello Russo]: for the following grade, public safety one, firefighter, public safety two, fire lieutenant, public safety three, fire captain, public safety four, deputy chief, public safety five, chief.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Section four, subsection 66.40, effective July 1st, 2016, add 1% of the present amount of each step within the grade shown below to the set present amount of each step and adjust the sum thus obtained to the nearest and highest figure for the following grade, public safety one, firefighter, public safety two,

[Fred Dello Russo]: Fire Lieutenant, Public Safety 3, Fire Captain, Public Safety 4, Fire Deputy Chief, Public Safety 5, Chief.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Section 5 in subsection 66.40, effective January 1st, 2014, add one and one-half percent of the following amount of each step within the grade shown below to the set present amount of each step and adjust the sum thus obtained to the nearest and highest figure for the following grade.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Public Safety 1, Firefighter, Public Safety 2, Fire Lieutenant, Public Safety 3,

[Fred Dello Russo]: Fire Captain, Public Safety 4, Fire Deputy Chief, Public Safety 5, Chief.

[Fred Dello Russo]: This agreement is requested due to recently negotiated agreement with Local 1032 IAFF, the Firefighters Union.

[Fred Dello Russo]: I have attached a proposed classification plan for your review.

[Fred Dello Russo]: It is estimated that the contract will cost approximately $1 million through June 30th, 2015, which includes retroactive payments beginning January 1st, 2014,

[Fred Dello Russo]: and includes payments to retirees who retired after January 1st, 2014.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Retroactive payments prior to fiscal year 2016 were made once ordained by your honorable body.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Separate transfer paper from negotiated salary count and free cash is on the agenda for your consideration.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Very truly yours, Stephanie M. Burke, Mayor.

[Fred Dello Russo]: We have attached to this an outline that gives the steps

[Fred Dello Russo]: detailed amounts for each year, for each percent, for all of these matters.

[Fred Dello Russo]: And we have here to report before us Louise Miller, our Honorable Director of Budgeting and Purchasing, and who was instrumental in the negotiation process and formation of this very good contract.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Ms.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Miller, if you would.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Mr. Clerk, would you mark present Councilors Falco, Knight, and Scampelli.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Thank you.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Councilors, any questions?

[Fred Dello Russo]: Madam Vice President.

[Fred Dello Russo]: On the motion for approval by Councilor Knight, do members of the Firefighters Union, IAFF, Local 1032, wish to address us?

[Fred Dello Russo]: We have a motion for approval by Councilor Knight, seconded by Councilor Caraviello.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Councilor Scarpelli.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Mr. President, very good.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Councilor Knight.

[Fred Dello Russo]: We'll wait for the vote.

[Fred Dello Russo]: On the motion for approval for a first reading, Councilor Marks.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Thank you.

[Fred Dello Russo]: On the motion for approval by Councilor Knight, seconded by Councilor Caraviello for the first reading.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Mr. Clark, please call the roll.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Councilor Caraviello.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Motion to waive the three readings.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Motion to waive the three readings.

[Fred Dello Russo]: by Councilor Caraviello.

[Fred Dello Russo]: On the motion to waive the three readings by Councilor Caraviello.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Councilor Marks.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Thank you.

[Fred Dello Russo]: On the motion of Councilor Caraviello,

[Fred Dello Russo]: Mr. Clerk, please call the roll of the waiving of the three readings.

[Fred Dello Russo]: President Dello Russo?

[Fred Dello Russo]: No.

[Fred Dello Russo]: With the vote of four in the affirmative, three in the negative, the motion passes.

[Fred Dello Russo]: On the main motion, for all three readings, you have to have to vote in the affirmative.

[Fred Dello Russo]: So for the first reading, this will be for the first reading.

[Fred Dello Russo]: because there was not a, uh, unanimous consent to waive all three readings.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Uh, we will, uh, follow the standard procedure with any ordinance, and this will be subjected to three readings.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Therefore, we will have the first reading vote now on the motion of approval by Councilor Knight as seconded by Councilor Caraviello.

[Fred Dello Russo]: For the first reading, Mr. Clerk, please call the roll.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Yes.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Yes.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Yes.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Yes.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Yes.

[Fred Dello Russo]: We vote seven in the affirmative, none in the negative.

[Fred Dello Russo]: The matter passes its first reading.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Congratulations.

[Fred Dello Russo]: So, 16-077, hearings, locations of poles, attachments of fixtures, and underground conduits, Medford, Massachusetts, city clerk's office.

[Fred Dello Russo]: You are hereby notified that by order of the City Council, a public hearing will be given at the Howard F. Alden Memorial Auditorium, 85 George P. Hassett Drive, City Hall, Medford, Massachusetts at 7 p.m.

[Fred Dello Russo]: on Tuesday, February 23rd, 2016 on a petition of National Grid of Andover for permission to locate poles and fixtures, including the necessary sustaining and protecting fixtures along and across the following public way.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Governor's Avenue.

[Fred Dello Russo]: National grid beginning at a point approximately 10 feet west of the central line of the intersection of Governors Ave and continuing approximately five feet in a westerly direction.

[Fred Dello Russo]: National grid to install five feet plus or minus one or three inches, a secondary conduct from existing manhole onto the property of 28 Governors Ave for new service to a residential home.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Wherefore, it prays that under due notice and hearing as provided by law, it be granted a location for and permission to erect and maintain poles and wires together with sustaining and protecting fixtures as it may find necessary.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Set poles to be erected substantially

[Fred Dello Russo]: in accordance with the plan filed herewith, marked Governors Ave, Medford, No.

[Fred Dello Russo]: 20944570, January 6, 2016.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Approved by the City Engineer, no city-owned or private utilities or other structures are adversely impacted.

[Fred Dello Russo]: National Grid shall ensure that all sewer, water, and drain lines are marked prior to any excavation.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Any disturbed concrete sidewalk panels shall be replaced in kind unless said panels are being replaced by the resident's contractor.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Asphalt must be replaced by asphalt.

[Fred Dello Russo]: An as-built sketch must be delivered to the residence's contractor for incorporation into the overall as-built for the site.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Before beginning work, contractors shall notify DIGSAFE and shall obtain applicable permits from the engineering division.

[Fred Dello Russo]: The contractor shall utilize City of Medford regulations and standards for restoration, as well as remove all debris related to its work approved by the superintendent of wires

[Fred Dello Russo]: Call 781-393-245 for any accommodations, et cetera, et cetera.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Edward P. Finn, City Clerk.

[Fred Dello Russo]: I now open the public hearing.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Yes.

[Fred Dello Russo]: who were eligible to vote in the last state election, as is required by General Law, Chapter 43B, Paragraph 3, in that the Municipal Charter Commission, once elected, shall be charged with the duty of recommending revisions and amendments to the present city charter, in that their recommendations include, at a minimum, an amendment to the present city charter, instituting an appointment

[Fred Dello Russo]: an appointed committee whose purposes will be to conduct a periodic review of the City Charter.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Further, that the Municipal Charter Commission, once elected, will be required to submit its final report of up to five recommendations for revisions or amendments to our present City Charter on or before June 30th, 2020.

[Fred Dello Russo]: congestion, buses, transportation in general.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Uh, the clerk is going to invite, uh, the city, uh, engineer, uh, the, uh, state delegation.

[Fred Dello Russo]: and a representative Mr. Daly of department of transportation, as well as a representative of Zoppo construction to meet with the city council on this matter.

[Fred Dello Russo]: We'll have present with us also, uh, the, uh, city solicitor Wednesday coming not tomorrow, the following Wednesday.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Very good.

[Fred Dello Russo]: What's next Wednesday's date?

[Fred Dello Russo]: 27th.

[Fred Dello Russo]: 27th.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Thank you.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Mr. Citizen.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Thank you.

[Fred Dello Russo]: We're going to adjourn.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Mr. Castagnetti wishes to.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Thank you, Mr. Castagnetti.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Uh, thank you.

[Fred Dello Russo]: I just thought you forgot something.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Go Patriots!

[Fred Dello Russo]: Motion for adjournment.

[Fred Dello Russo]: On the motion of adjournment by Councilor Caraviello, seconded by Councilor Falco.

[Fred Dello Russo]: All those in favor?

[Fred Dello Russo]: All those opposed?

[Fred Dello Russo]: 241 years ago, it was 12 by the village o'clock when he crossed the bridge into MetroTown.

[Fred Dello Russo]: He heard the crowing of the cock and the barking of the farmer's dog, and felt the damp of the river flood that rises after the sun goes down.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Well, we're finally fixing that bridge.

[Fred Dello Russo]: That held a significant role in the foundation of our nation.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Local patriots, people who were inspired by freedom,

[Fred Dello Russo]: peace and prosperity, the opportunity to live fruitful lives and enjoy the fruits of their labor, stood up and were ready to take their place in what would happen.

[Fred Dello Russo]: It wasn't easy.

[Fred Dello Russo]: It took time, blood, sweat, and tears.

[Fred Dello Russo]: But it got done.

[Fred Dello Russo]: They built something which would speak to the ages, a new nation, a new community of people.

[Fred Dello Russo]: As rumor has it, Paul Revere just didn't pass through Medford Square.

[Fred Dello Russo]: He had a drink in the home of a local distiller and the captain of Medford militia, Isaac Hall.

[Fred Dello Russo]: He stopped in the square.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Now, if anybody was in a hurry to pass through the square, it was he.

[Fred Dello Russo]: What a precedent, he said.

[Fred Dello Russo]: A precedent we need to follow.

[Fred Dello Russo]: The revolutionary impulse wasn't shared by all.

[Fred Dello Russo]: In fact, some people had it pretty good here, and some were just comfortable in their ways.

[Fred Dello Russo]: But as we reflect on our national roots today, let us consider our desire to build anew.

[Fred Dello Russo]: our commitment to forging new bonds of community where newcomers and old settlers work together towards common greatness.

[Fred Dello Russo]: As we did capitalize on what Metro Square had to offer, let us do the same.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Building on good work done in years past, harvesting the desire in our citizens' hearts, may we continue on our plans to renew and build for the ages.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Good, great.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Welcome all to the second regular meeting of the Medford City Council, which is now called to order.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Gentlemen, please remove your hats.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Mr. Clerk, please call the roll.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Present.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Seven members present, none absent.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Please rise and join us in the salute of the flag.

[Fred Dello Russo]: I pledge allegiance to the flag of the United States of America

[Fred Dello Russo]: and to the Republic for which it stands, one nation, under God, indivisible, with liberty and justice for all.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Wow.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Commendations 15-777.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Commendations were offered by Councilor Knight for the Medford High School class of 2015 Greater Boston League Champions varsity golf.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Medford High School, 2015 Greater Boston League Champions, Varsity Boys Soccer, and Medford High School, 2015 Greater Boston League Champions, Varsity Girls Soccer.

[Fred Dello Russo]: At this time, we invite Councilor Knight-Ford to lead us in the presentations.

[Fred Dello Russo]: 15-776, offered by Councilor Caraviello.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Congratulations to the Medford Junior Mustangs, Medford Youth Football, Junior Varsity Football Team, Eastern Massachusetts Champions, Commonwealth Youth Football Conference Champions, undefeated.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Medford Junior Mustangs, Medford Youth, chairing varsity, junior varsity, and freshman Commonwealth Youth Chair Conference Champions.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Councilor, there you are.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Thank you, Mr. President.

[Fred Dello Russo]: All those opposed?

[Fred Dello Russo]: 651 entitled Appointment and Qualification and to Article 4, Division 4, City Solicitor, Section 2-652 entitled Term.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Dear Mr. President and members of the Medford City Council, I respectfully request and recommend that your Honorable body approve the following amendment to Article 4, Division 4, City Solicitor, Section 2-651 entitled Appointment and Qualification.

[Fred Dello Russo]: into Article 4, Division 4, City Solicitor, Section 2-652, Entitled to Term.

[Fred Dello Russo]: So 16-021, to the Honorable President, members of the Medford City Council, re-amendment to Division 4 by the addition of a Division 4A entitled Chief of Staff and Policy, and further adding Section 2680 entitled Appointments and Duties.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Dear Mr. President and members of the City Council, I respectfully request and recommend that your Honorable body approve the following amendment to Division 4 by the addition of a

[Fred Dello Russo]: Division 4A, entitled Chief of Staff and Policy, and further adding Section 2680, entitled Appointment and Duties.

[Fred Dello Russo]: The purpose of this amendment to the revised ordinances is the creation of a position called Chief of Staff and Policy to advise the mayor on policy matters and to act as personnel director.

[Fred Dello Russo]: An amendment to the revised ordinances of the City Method, Article 4, Officers,

[Fred Dello Russo]: and employees division for a chief of staff and policy section two six 80 appointment and duties be it ordained by the city council of the city of Medford that article four of the revised ordinances of the city of Medford as most recently amended is hereby further amended by the addition of division for a entitled chief of staff and policy and further adding section two dash six 80 entitled appointment and duties said section shall state

[Fred Dello Russo]: there shall be a chief of staff and policy who shall be appointed by the mayor.

[Fred Dello Russo]: The duties of the chief of staff and policy shall include the following.

[Fred Dello Russo]: A, advise the mayor on matters of municipal policy.

[Fred Dello Russo]: B, manage communications and information both to and from the office of mayor.

[Fred Dello Russo]: C, act as director of personnel being responsible for advising the mayor on matters of employee compensation, benefits administration, and fostering employee services

[Fred Dello Russo]: safely, safety, and welfare.

[Fred Dello Russo]: D, advise the mayor and department heads on matters of employee discipline.

[Fred Dello Russo]: E, be responsible for representing the mayor in all collective bargaining sessions, including all grievances, arbitrations, and all matters relating thereto.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Respectfully submitted, Stephanie Muccini-Burke, mayor.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Again, the city solicitor is here to report to us on this matter.

[Fred Dello Russo]: The motion to table is undebatable.

[Fred Dello Russo]: All those in favor?

[Fred Dello Russo]: 16-022 to the Honorable President and members of the Medford City Council, re-amendment to Article 5, Finance Division 2, Procurement Section 2931, entitled Procurement Office or Appointment Term and Authority.

[Fred Dello Russo]: 931, entitled Procurement Officer Appointment Term and Authority.

[Fred Dello Russo]: The purpose of this amendment is to provide for a new position that has two components, Chief Budget Officer and Chief Procurement Officer.

[Fred Dello Russo]: An amendment to the revised ordinances of the City of Medford, Article 5, Finance, Division 2, Procurement, Section 2, 931, Chief Procurement Officer Appointment

[Fred Dello Russo]: term and authority be it ordained by the city council of the city of Medford that division four of the revised ordinances of the city of Medford as most recently amendment is hereby further amended by changing the language of article five, uh, finance a division to procurement section two nine 31 entitled procurement officer appointment term and authority set sectionally previous, uh, presently states,

[Fred Dello Russo]: There shall be a chief procurement officer who shall be appointed by the mayor.

[Fred Dello Russo]: He or she shall hold office for a term of three years from the first Monday of January in the year of his or her appointment.

[Fred Dello Russo]: The chief procurement officer shall have charge of the purchasing department.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Purchasing Department shall be under the direction and control of the Director of Finance slash Auditor.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Language in Section 5, Finance, Division 4, Procurement, Section 2, 931, Entitled Procurement Officer.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Appointment, term, and authority shall be amended to read as the following.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Article 5 of Finance, Division 2, Budget and Procurement, Section 2, 931.

[Fred Dello Russo]: I've made a mistake in reading.

[Fred Dello Russo]: It originally said March, so it's going to be amended for the new one.

[Fred Dello Russo]: to reach January.

[Fred Dello Russo]: There shall be a Chief Budget and Procurement Officer who shall be appointed by the Mayor.

[Fred Dello Russo]: He or she shall hold office for a term of three years from the first Monday of January in the year of her appointment.

[Fred Dello Russo]: The Chief Budget and Procurement Officer shall, in collaboration with the various departments, A, annually prepare and submit a proposed operating budget and capital improvement budget to the Mayor on a timely basis for submission to the City Council, B, attend all City Council budget subcommittee meetings,

[Fred Dello Russo]: Committee of the whole meetings and regular or specially scheduled meetings of the Medford City Council that pertain to budgets.

[Fred Dello Russo]: C, have charge of the purchasing department.

[Fred Dello Russo]: D, perform all duties required of a chief procurement officer under Massachusetts general laws.

[Fred Dello Russo]: E, report directly to the mayor on matters that pertain to budgets.

[Fred Dello Russo]: F, report to the director of finance slash auditing on matters that pertain to procurement.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Respectfully submitted, Stephanie Muccini-Burke, mayor.

[Fred Dello Russo]: 16-024 to the Honorable President and members of the Medford City Council, City Hall, Metro-Massachusetts 155, reamendment to Chapter 66, Personnel, Article 3, Personnel Policy, Section 66-64, entitled Vacation.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Dear Mr. President and members of the City Council, I respectfully request and recommend that your Honorable body approve the following amendment to Chapter 66, Personnel, Article 3, Personnel Policy, Section 66-64, entitled Vacation of the revised ordinances of the City of Medford.

[Fred Dello Russo]: The purpose of this amendment is to allow new employees to accrue vacation from the start of their employment, but to prohibit them from using any vacation time that accrues until after the passage of six months from the start of their employment.

[Fred Dello Russo]: An amendment to the revised ordinances of the city of Medford chapter 66 personnel article three personnel policy section 66 dash 64 vacation be it ordained by the city council of the city of Medford that division four of the revised ordinances

[Fred Dello Russo]: The City Method, as most recently amended, is hereby further amended by changing the language of Chapter 66, Personnel Article, Personnel Policy, Section 66-64, entitled Vacation.

[Fred Dello Russo]: That same section presently states, generally, all...

[Fred Dello Russo]: permanent officers and employees of the city with the exceptions noted in section 66-61 shall receive a vacation without loss of pay in each calendar year if he or she has actually worked for 30 weeks in the aggregate during the 12 months preceding June 1st in such calendar year.

[Fred Dello Russo]: The language of said vacation

[Fred Dello Russo]: of said section 66-64 shall be amended to read as follows.

[Fred Dello Russo]: And I'm taking the amended version that was presented to us by the solicitor and committee of the whole.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Is that correct, Mr. Soliciting?

[Fred Dello Russo]: So the amended one shall be read into the record tonight, the one that you distributed to us.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Correct.

[Fred Dello Russo]: So the language of said section 66-64 shall be amended

[Fred Dello Russo]: to read as follows.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Vacation.

[Fred Dello Russo]: General.

[Fred Dello Russo]: All permanent officers and employees of the city, with the exception of noted in section 66-61, shall receive a vacation without loss of pay in each calendar year, which shall be based on the number of years of their employment.

[Fred Dello Russo]: During the first six months following the inception of the employment, said permanent officers and employees of the city may not utilize any vacation time

[Fred Dello Russo]: but this requirement shall not prohibit the accrual of the same during that six month period.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Mr. Solicitor.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Move approval on the motion for approval by

[Fred Dello Russo]: Councilor Knight, this would be the first reading on this ordinance change.

[Fred Dello Russo]: On the motion of approval of Councilor Knight, seconded by Councilor Caraviello.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Mr. Clerk, please call the roll for the first reading.

[Fred Dello Russo]: With a vote of seven in the affirmative, none in the negative.

[Fred Dello Russo]: It passes the first reading.

[Fred Dello Russo]: On the motion of Councilor Knight to waive the additional readings.

[Fred Dello Russo]: All those in favor?

[Fred Dello Russo]: All those opposed?

[Fred Dello Russo]: All those opposed?

[Fred Dello Russo]: Motion carries.

[Fred Dello Russo]: and better future for the next generation, for the people of Medford.

[Fred Dello Russo]: On the motion of Councilor Marks to table, all those in favor?

[Fred Dello Russo]: Aye.

[Fred Dello Russo]: All those opposed?

[Fred Dello Russo]: Aye.

[Fred Dello Russo]: One in opposition.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Councilor Camuso.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Motion is tabled.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Undebatable.

[Fred Dello Russo]: While we're into suspension, this is a wonderful evening of celebration tonight.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Two members of the city council will be retiring, leaving the council, and we wish them well.

[Fred Dello Russo]: They each have many members of their families and friends and longtime supporters with them here tonight to help us in that celebration.

[Fred Dello Russo]: But as is custom, we'll give, at this time, invite each of the Councilors the opportunity to make a final address on this occasion and to speak to their colleagues and to the people of Medford.

[Fred Dello Russo]: And then after such presentations,

[Fred Dello Russo]: uh, of, uh, speeches on behalf, uh, from both, uh, members will, uh, adjourn, uh, to enjoy some refreshments and presentations of, uh, gifts from the city council.

[Fred Dello Russo]: So at this time we're going to do you want to do them afterwards or do you want to do them all together?

[Fred Dello Russo]: So we'll have a meeting that's short on business and long on celebration for both of them.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Thank you all.

[Fred Dello Russo]: All those opposed?

[Fred Dello Russo]: back in the regular order of business, a public hearing, 15-757.

[Fred Dello Russo]: A public hearing will be held of the Medford City Council and the Howard F. Alden Memorial Chamber's City Hall Medford Mass on Tuesday, December 8, 2015 at 7 p.m.

[Fred Dello Russo]: The purpose of the hearing

[Fred Dello Russo]: is to hear the Board of Assessors on the following items for the purpose of allocation of the fiscal year 2016 property tax.

[Fred Dello Russo]: One, to determine the residential factor to be used for fiscal year 2016.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Two, select an open space discount.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Three, select a residential exemption.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Four, select a small commercial exemption.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Call 781-393-2425 for any aids, accommodations, et cetera, by order of the Medford City Council, Medford, Edward P. Finn, City Clerk.

[Fred Dello Russo]: In opposition to the matter as presented in the public hearing as outlined by the assessor, Mr. O'Neill, the four-point plan to, one, determine the residential factor to be used, two, adopt an open space discount, three, adopt a residential exemption, four, adopt a small commercial exemption.

[Fred Dello Russo]: On the motion of Councilor Camuso to move the four questions.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Number one, to determine the residential factor to be used for the fiscal year 2016 by selecting the minimum residential factor, a percentage of the total tax levy will be shifted from the residential taxpayer to the commercial, industrial, and personal property taxpayers.

[Fred Dello Russo]: This results in a lower tax rate for residential properties and a higher tax rate for commercial, industrial and personal property taxpayers.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Historically, the Council has chosen the minimum residential factor

[Fred Dello Russo]: If this is once again, the council choice, the minimum residential factor is 0.897446.

[Fred Dello Russo]: To adopt an open space discount.

[Fred Dello Russo]: This does not apply to the city of Medford.

[Fred Dello Russo]: We're not eligible for that, but a no vote is required.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Mr. Clerk, please call the roll.

[Fred Dello Russo]: No.

[Fred Dello Russo]: With the vote of six in the negative and one absent, the adoption fails.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Number three, adopt a residential exemption.

[Fred Dello Russo]: If adopted, owner-occupied residential properties

[Fred Dello Russo]: may receive an exemption of up to 20% of the average residential value.

[Fred Dello Russo]: This is accomplished by shifting a portion of the tax levy from the owner-occupied residential properties to non-owner-occupied properties.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Since this shift causes a higher residential tax rate, the number of owner-occupied properties would also see an increase in their tax rate, tax bills.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Councilor Penta.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Duly noted.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Number four, adopt a small commercial exemption if adopted, commercial properties

[Fred Dello Russo]: housing a business employing 10 or less people and valued at less than $1 million may receive an exemption of up to 10 percent of their assessed value.

[Fred Dello Russo]: This is accomplished by shifting a portion of the commercial industrial tax levy from these eligible properties to the other commercial and or industrial properties.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Since this shift causes a high commercial and industrial tax rate, all commercial industrial not receiving the exemption

[Fred Dello Russo]: would see an increase in their tax bills.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Mr. Clerk, please call the roll.

[Fred Dello Russo]: No.

[Fred Dello Russo]: On the vote of five in the negative, one in the affirmative, one absent, the motion fails.

[Fred Dello Russo]: And finally, offered by the entire membership of the Medford City Council, be it resolved that the Medford City Council offer its sincere condolences to the family of Alfonso Alfreza on his recent passing.

[Fred Dello Russo]: If I may, from the chair, state that

[Fred Dello Russo]: Mr. Fraser died yesterday or early this morning after an accident.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Al was the longtime managing editor of the Medford Daily Mercury when it was an engaged, active, and considerate newspaper in the community.

[Fred Dello Russo]: He served as a kingmaker in many ways for many of the young local athletes for generations, making sure that they were acknowledged for their athletic achievement and prowess and also for their good sportsmanship.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Al finished out his career after years in the newspaper by serving as chief of staff to longtime president of the, I'm sorry, speaker of the Massachusetts House of Representatives, George Kaverian, and also served for several years as a legislative liaison for the Environmental Protection Agency.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Al was 89 years old, I think, and was a good man to this community.

[Fred Dello Russo]: So if you would all join me in rising for a moment of silence.

[Fred Dello Russo]: It was, uh, item number 15 dash, uh, five 73 that came to us and was sent back to the, uh, uh, zoning amendments, uh, board.

[Fred Dello Russo]: This is, uh, to the honorable, uh, president and members of the Medford city council from Lauren D Lorenzo director, October 28th, 2015 regarding the proposed zoning amendment to safe access to medical marijuana in the city of Medford recommendation to the city council from the community development board.

[Fred Dello Russo]: The following, uh, following a duly advertised public hearing conducted on October 5th and October 7th, 2015,

[Fred Dello Russo]: August 5th and October 7th, 2015.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Yes, Councilor.

[Fred Dello Russo]: So this came before us.

[Fred Dello Russo]: We sent it back to the Zoning Board for their perusal and public hearings.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Our approval of this will then allow it to go to a further public hearing, Mr. Clerk.

[Fred Dello Russo]: in advertisement, uh, with the following, uh, amendments to the original paper that were made, uh, by the zoning board.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Um, and these were some of these were, um, uh, technical, uh, amendments as you can see in the document.

[Fred Dello Russo]: So our purpose tonight, uh, is to, uh, consider these, uh, additions that were made and then to, uh, send the

[Fred Dello Russo]: paper out for public hearing again.

[Fred Dello Russo]: To review this with okay.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Very good.

[Fred Dello Russo]: So on the motion of council tonight that this paper be referred to committee of the whole, with all pertinent department heads in attendance.

[Fred Dello Russo]: That would be the OCD director, director of public health, the director of prevention and outreach, as well as the city solicitor.

[Fred Dello Russo]: All those in favor?

[Fred Dello Russo]: Aye.

[Fred Dello Russo]: All those opposed?

[Fred Dello Russo]: 15-691, communication from the Mayor.

[Fred Dello Russo]: October 1st, 2015, Council President, Medford City Council, from Mayor Michael J. McGlynn, home rule petition regarding rights upon

[Fred Dello Russo]: Dear Mr. President and City Councilors, I respectfully request and recommend your Honorable Body approve the attached Home Rule petition to be sent to the General Court regarding the use of Wright's Pond.

[Fred Dello Russo]: This Home Rule petition has been drafted by the City Solicitor after the completion of historical research on Wright's Pond that included a title search, reference to earlier operations by past Medford City Solicitors, the assistance of State Representative Paul J. Donato, in consultation with

[Fred Dello Russo]: House Council of the Massachusetts House of Representatives.

[Fred Dello Russo]: The approval of this home rule petition by the General Court would remove any ambiguity and establish with finality and clarity that the use of the beach at Wright's Pond and the area that services the beach can be restricted and limited to residents of Medford and their invitees to the exclusion of others.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Respectfully submitted, Michael J. McGlynn, Mayor.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Uh, the enclosure is an act of establishing the city of Medford to use certain land for any municipal purpose, be it enacted, et cetera, as far as follows, notwithstanding any law regulation or ordinance.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Very good on that motion.

[Fred Dello Russo]: All in favor.

[Fred Dello Russo]: All those opposed.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Mr. Solicitor.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Welcome.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Thank you.

[Fred Dello Russo]: The chair recognizes Councilor Camuso.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Thank you, Councilor.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Councilor Penta.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Hearings 15-629 City of Medford notice of public hearing.

[Fred Dello Russo]: A public hearing will be held by the Medford City Council in the Howard F. Alden Memorial Auditorium City Hall, 86 George P. Assett Drive, Medford, Massachusetts on Tuesday evening, September 29th,

[Fred Dello Russo]: 2015 at 7 PM, on a petition from Asian Palace doing business as Shanghai Moon for special permit to amend its hours of operations in accordance with Metro Zoning Ordinance Chapter 94, Section 94 to 145, to operate extended hours at its business at 442 Salem Street, Metro Massachusetts.

[Fred Dello Russo]: On said site being located in the C1, that's commercial one, zoning district.

[Fred Dello Russo]: The amendation is for Sunday, Monday, Tuesday, and Wednesday, 11 p.m.

[Fred Dello Russo]: to 12 a.m., and Thursday, Friday, and Saturday from 11 p.m.

[Fred Dello Russo]: extended to 1 a.m.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Petition and plan may be seen in the office of the city clerk, Medford City Hall, Medford, Massachusetts.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Call 781-393-2425 for any accommodations.

[Fred Dello Russo]: etc., etc., by order of the City Council, Edward P. Finn, City Clerk, advertised in Medford Daily Mercury, September 15th and September 22nd, 2015.

[Fred Dello Russo]: When we have a portion of our meeting that's a public hearing, what we do is we first invite those who are in favor to just come up and state they are in favor of this measure.

[Fred Dello Russo]: And then you may be seated.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Once all those who are in favor and acknowledge they are in favor of this are finished, we close that portion of the meeting, then invite all those up to state whether they are in opposition to that.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Once people have just made the simple statement that they're in opposition, we close that portion of the public hearing, and then we go into the discussion phase to hear the merits presented by both parties, whether those are in favor and those are opposed.

[Fred Dello Russo]: And then the council has the opportunity to speak, perhaps ask questions, and then render its decision.

[Fred Dello Russo]: So now that the public hearing is open, the chair invites those who are in favor to come forward to the podium and to identify yourself by your name and address and state that you are in favor.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Thank you.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Anybody else in favor?

[Fred Dello Russo]: Please come forward and state that you're in favor.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Share your name and address for the record, please.

[Fred Dello Russo]: In favor.

[Fred Dello Russo]: As stated at the beginning of this portion, we explained that that would happen.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Oh.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Thank you, John.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Very good.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Anybody else in favor?

[Fred Dello Russo]: Anybody else in favor?

[Fred Dello Russo]: Hearing and seeing none, we declare that

[Fred Dello Russo]: portion of the meeting closed.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Anybody in opposition?

[Fred Dello Russo]: Anybody in opposition, please present yourself to the rostrum and state your name and address for the record.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Are you here in opposition?

[Fred Dello Russo]: Sir, you want to speak on this matter?

[Fred Dello Russo]: Please state your name and address for the record, senator.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Thank you for your kind input, senator.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Chair recognizes counsel Tanta.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Thank you.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Was there a motion in there?

[Fred Dello Russo]: Councilor Penta?

[Fred Dello Russo]: I would like to resolution before us.

[Fred Dello Russo]: is offered by Councilor Knight, right?

[Fred Dello Russo]: But so I, yeah, I passed.

[Fred Dello Russo]: So I have no problem with the night's motion for an update on Councilor Penta's related motion.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Mr. Clark has a B paper as a B paper.

[Fred Dello Russo]: And, sir, you wish to address us?

[Fred Dello Russo]: Please state your name and address for the record.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Good evening, Mr. President.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Thank you for that point of information, and thank you for your use of the word bifurcation.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Mr. President.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Doctor.

[Fred Dello Russo]: And... Point of information, Councilor Knight.

[Fred Dello Russo]: And not debate with individual Councilors.

[Fred Dello Russo]: That's our procedure.

[Fred Dello Russo]: I think what the council is trying to do, if I can help you, is apply a measure that's been successful tremendously in many urban areas to attract business and thus create

[Fred Dello Russo]: an atmosphere of urban renewal and success in neighborhoods that are both commercial and residential.

[Fred Dello Russo]: And Councilor Camuso wishes to be recognized.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Motions, orders, and resolutions 15-644 offered by Vice President Lungo-Koehn be it resolved that the City of Medford purchase the Aqua Hawk system and install it within the near future.

[Fred Dello Russo]: The system would be applied to individual water meters as an individual meter leak detection system.

[Fred Dello Russo]: This purchase and installation would relieve rate payers from having to pay substantial sums

[Fred Dello Russo]: due to leaks they were unaware of.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Be it further resolved that the city council hold a meeting, committee meeting, to discuss a detection system to monitor leaks within our waterline infrastructure.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Past leaks within our infrastructure have cost the rate payer a substantial amount of money, and we need to work to avoid this problem.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Madam Vice President.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Thank you very much for that important measure, Madam Vice President.

[Fred Dello Russo]: May I take this opportunity to point out that the unfortunate thing of all this is that the system we have in place now was sold to us with the point of having this capability built into it.

[Fred Dello Russo]: So on 15-619, to the President, to members of the Medford City Council, from Mayor McGlynn, regarding the establishment of a revolving account for the Medford Community Guiding Commission.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Dear Mr. President, to members of the City Council, I respectfully request and recommend that your Honorable body approve the establishment of a revolving account under General Laws, Chapter 44, Paragraph 53E and a half, to serve the Medford Community Guiding Commission with the following provisions.

[Fred Dello Russo]: One, the fees received from the community garden members or plot holders, along with any donations, will be deposited into the revolving account.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Two, the revolving account will provide a source for the payment of expenses related to the community gardens for items such as, but not limited to, equipment, supplies, and maintenance.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Three, the director of the Office of Energy and Environment shall have the authority, in accordance with all applicable law,

[Fred Dello Russo]: to approve expenditures from the revolving account.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Four, the total amount of annual expenditures from the revolving account shall be limited to $10,000, but in any event, expenditures shall not exceed the balance of the account.

[Fred Dello Russo]: And five, the Director of the Office of Energy and Environment shall annually prepare a report disclosing all deposits and expenditures from the revolving account for the current fiscal year.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Respectfully submitted, Michael J. McGlynn, Mayor, etc.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Vice President Lungelkirch.

[Fred Dello Russo]: So, uh, amending, uh, uh, paragraph number five to include, uh, the mayor and city council in that report, uh, as amended.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Did anybody else want to offer amendments?

[Fred Dello Russo]: On the motion of approval by Councilor Marx, Councilor Knight.

[Fred Dello Russo]: So on the motion of approval by Councilor Marks as amended by Councilor Lango-Kern and Councilor Knight.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Sir, you wish to speak on this matter.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Chair recognizes Councilor Marks to take a paper out of order.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Yes, Mr. President, paper 15-591, on order $2,120 for capital approvals to the city sewer system.

[Fred Dello Russo]: On the motion of Council Marks to take paper for the final reading, paper number 15591.

[Fred Dello Russo]: All those in favor?

[Fred Dello Russo]: We're getting there.

[Fred Dello Russo]: This was in committee of the whole.

[Fred Dello Russo]: We have the third reading before us.

[Fred Dello Russo]: This was a paper presented

[Fred Dello Russo]: to the Council at the last Council meeting.

[Fred Dello Russo]: It had its second reading by advertisement and now it's up for its third reading.

[Fred Dello Russo]: It's a request for a loan order of $2,120,000 that will be expended upon improvements to sewer and drainage in North Medford.

[Fred Dello Russo]: It's a loan from the Mass Water Resource Authority, MWRA, that

[Fred Dello Russo]: Its components are a 45% grant, so once we receive the loan, 45% of it is a grant, and 55% of it is repayable over a five-year period at 0% interest.

[Fred Dello Russo]: So $1,000,000, was it $166,000?

[Fred Dello Russo]: $666,000 is repayable over a five-year period.

[Fred Dello Russo]: In our deliberations in the committee of the whole, we moved approval with the caveat that that repaid amount be taken out of the sewer enterprise account.

[Fred Dello Russo]: So if we have a motion on the floor for this, Councilor Penta.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Motion of approval by Councilor Penta.

[Fred Dello Russo]: We have also part of the committee report

[Fred Dello Russo]: that the engineer provide a listing of the streets in the North Medford project, that the mayor utilize Waterloo sewer enterprise account in future projects, that a percentage of infiltration and inflow be reported back to us, and how much?

[Fred Dello Russo]: and how much has been allocated from the MWRA in total.

[Fred Dello Russo]: So we have all that.

[Fred Dello Russo]: And now we have Councilor Penta has moved approval and that this debt of $1,166,000 be not only paid from the Sue Enterprise account, but it be done so within the first year.

[Fred Dello Russo]: On the motion for approval, Mr. Stroller wants to speak.

[Fred Dello Russo]: We're going to focus on the matter before us.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Thank you very much, councillor.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Thank you, doctor.

[Fred Dello Russo]: is contrary to the way it was reported out of committee.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Point of information, Councilor Camuso.

[Fred Dello Russo]: All those opposed.

[Fred Dello Russo]: No.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Suspension of the rules for what purpose?

[Fred Dello Russo]: Motion of Councilman Knight to take 15591.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Before us now, communication from the mayor to President Dello Russo and members of the city council, from Mayor Michael J. McGlynn, regarding loan order, capital improvements to city sewer system.

[Fred Dello Russo]: City of Medford, Massachusetts loan order.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Be it ordered that the sum of $2,120,000 be and hereby is appropriated to pay costs of making capital improvements to the city's sewer system, including the payment of all costs, incidental or related thereto,

[Fred Dello Russo]: in that to meet this appropriation, the city treasurer, with the approval of the mayor, is authorized to borrow said sum and to issue bonds or notes of the city, therefore, in the aggregate principal amount of $2,120,000, under and pursuant to Chapter 44, Section 7, Chapter 1 of Massachusetts General Laws, as amended and supplemented, or pursuant to any other enabling authority.

[Fred Dello Russo]: The treasurer is authorized to borrow all or any portion

[Fred Dello Russo]: of the amount appropriated by this order through the Massachusetts Water Resource Authority Local Financial Assistance Program.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Sincerely yours, Michael J. McGlynn, Mayor, signature on file.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Before us to make a presentation, we have Louise Miller, the Director of Budget, Finance, Personnel, and Purchasing, and Cassandra Koudelikas, the Chief Engineer for the City of Medford.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Uh, while we're, uh, taking papers out of the, uh, off the table motion by council, Camuso,

[Fred Dello Russo]: to take item number 15486, Outreach Agent for Substance Abuse, which is eligible for the third and final reading.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Motion for approval by Councilor Camuso.

[Fred Dello Russo]: All those in favor?

[Fred Dello Russo]: All those opposed?

[Fred Dello Russo]: We received today an outline of the job description, definition, supervision provided, supervisory responsibilities, job environment, essential functions, et cetera.

[Fred Dello Russo]: for this job that we've approved in the budget and just ordained.

[Fred Dello Russo]: So, on the motion for approval by Councilor Camuso, roll call has been requested.

[Fred Dello Russo]: We have a motion for approval by Councilor Camuso for the third and final reading.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Roll call vote.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Roll call vote has been requested.

[Fred Dello Russo]: On that motion, Councilor Penta.

[Fred Dello Russo]: I'd be delighted.

[Fred Dello Russo]: The prevention and outreach program coordinator.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Definition.

[Fred Dello Russo]: The prevention and outreach coordinator will have day-to-day responsibility for the coordination of all substance

[Fred Dello Russo]: prevention grant and non-grant activities.

[Fred Dello Russo]: The goal is to provide and coordinate all substance prevention efforts in the city of Medford.

[Fred Dello Russo]: This position will also develop and deliver in coordination with Medford Police, Fire, and EMS, as well as the Medford School Department, evidence-based programming to decrease the use of all substances.

[Fred Dello Russo]: The coordinator will develop tracking of overdose cases to enable timely provision of information

[Fred Dello Russo]: referrals on treatment, and support in recovery to assist those with substance abuse disorders and families.

[Fred Dello Russo]: The coordinator will report to the director of public health for the city of Medford, will maintain confidentiality when assisting with public health functions and when exposed to public health department work, and will provide advocacy for the protection and advancement of the public health within the community.

[Fred Dello Russo]: The recommended minimum qualifications, five or more full-time related work experience, five or more years full-time related work experience with substance abuse disorder, master's degree in public health or a related field preferred, grant writing experience preferred.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Salary is your salary is not listed in this piece, but when we went through it on the budget, it was a, uh, uh, department level head.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Cause that was the physical requirements, minimal physical effort required when performing functions under typical office conditions while performing the duties of this job.

[Fred Dello Russo]: The employees frequently required to walk, sit, and talk or hear may spend several hours sitting or standing.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Do I need to go on?

[Fred Dello Russo]: whatever it might be to... I think in other parts of the job description, it's inferred that travel, interaction, and other forms of human intercourse will be required of this person, while the physical requirements oftentimes in the job description mean physical requirements.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Will the individual have to be able to lug a 500-pound duffel bag

[Fred Dello Russo]: up the center stairs of the rotunda of City Hall, will the individual be able to climb scaffolding outside of a building?

[Fred Dello Russo]: So those requirements are not there, but the regular requirements of one in an administrative position of this position seem to be required of them.

[Fred Dello Russo]: personally point out in my conversations and I think Councilor Camuso will also agree, the mayor went through great lengths in interviewing many constituencies collectively and individually regarding this matter and putting together this job.

[Fred Dello Russo]: On the motion, do you need to counsel?

[Fred Dello Russo]: No, this is the third reading for which it's eligible tonight.

[Fred Dello Russo]: The second reading took place in the posting of the matter.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Move the question.

[Fred Dello Russo]: On board for what?

[Fred Dello Russo]: I don't have information on that.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Measured Mass.

[Fred Dello Russo]: OCD application 2015-11-D.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Only one secondary allowed.

[Fred Dello Russo]: And a lot of the signage is conformity with requirements of the franchisee meets a national standard for the brand.

[Fred Dello Russo]: And if I could interject here, that's not what I was indicating.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Just that there was a standard of size as far as type and style.

[Fred Dello Russo]: That is correct.

[Fred Dello Russo]: It has to be reflective of the logo and meet a standard of the franchise holder.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Correct.

[Fred Dello Russo]: That is correct.

[Fred Dello Russo]: So Panera has particular colors, but whatever they are, they can't be purple and yellow because that's not their brand.

[Fred Dello Russo]: That's correct.

[Fred Dello Russo]: So the motion.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Do we have a motion?

[Fred Dello Russo]: And based upon any feedback we get from neighbors, consumers, et cetera, if there is any problems with this, the license permission to have the extended hours of operation will be withdrawn.

[Fred Dello Russo]: And that will also be done in the subsequent six months.

[Fred Dello Russo]: And then oftentimes within those periods of time, any issues can be resolved in that review.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Or if a teen seems to be a chronic issue, then the Councilors may feel that it's not appropriate to have a drive-through from 5 to 7.

[Fred Dello Russo]: We've not had any significant issue on any of the other operative drive-throughs.

[Fred Dello Russo]: in the city that we've been made aware of.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Dear Medford City Council members, enclosed is a copy of a letter that went to your constituents who reside on Burgett Avenue and Sunset Avenue.

[Fred Dello Russo]: This letter is to make them aware of an informational meeting we are holding about a new air rights project.

[Fred Dello Russo]: next to Cousins Gym in room 102.

[Fred Dello Russo]: DOT public notices, a letter be sent to the Governor expressing the disappointment and frustration

[Fred Dello Russo]: of this situation and seeks such help for having the state agency be accountable for its failure to honor the City Council requests for timely and updated information on this most important project that will present a major impact on our downtown business and traffic flow pattern.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Be it resolved that the Medford City Council goes on record in supporting Boston Pride Week.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Furthermore, that we go on record in supporting of human rights and equal access to all denominations, including gay, lesbian, transgender, bisexual, pansexual, and others.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Furthermore, that equal access

[Fred Dello Russo]: to all remain a priority of the city of Medford.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Councilor Camuso.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Thank you for moving to put an end to bigotry in our community, Councilor Camuso.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Roll call vote.

[Fred Dello Russo]: On the motion of Councilor Camuso.

[Fred Dello Russo]: On that motion offered by Councilor Camuso, Councilor Knight.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Very good.

[Fred Dello Russo]: On that motion.

[Fred Dello Russo]: 15-488, location of poles, attachments, or fixtures in underground conduits, Medford, Massachusetts City Clerk's Office.

[Fred Dello Russo]: You are hereby notified that by order of the Medford City Council,

[Fred Dello Russo]: public hearing will be given at the Howard F auditorium, 85 George P Hassett drives city hall, Metro, Massachusetts at 7 p.m.

[Fred Dello Russo]: on Tuesday, May 26, 2015 on a petition by national grid of North Andover, Massachusetts and Verizon, New England for permission to locate poles, wires, and fixtures, including the necessary sustaining and protecting fixtures along and across the following public way.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Riverside Ave, National Grid to relocate one jail pole.

[Fred Dello Russo]: National Grid proposes to relocate pole 1649 Riverside Avenue, 20 feet plus or minus northwest of existing location and install 10 feet plus or minus of two to four primary inch primary duct across public property onto 491 Riverside Avenue property for new service.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Wherefore, it prays that after due notice and hearing as provided by law, it be given permission to excavate the public highways and to run and maintain underground electrical conduits together with such sustaining and protecting fixtures as it may find necessary for the transmission of electricity.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Set underground conduits to be located substantially in accordance with the plan filed herewith marked National Grid, Riverside Ave, Medford, Massachusetts number

[Fred Dello Russo]: 1-834-9215, April 15th, 2015.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Approved, City Engineer.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Upon review of this petition, this work of moving the existing pole and underground conduit can proceed forthwith, provided the following requirements are met.

[Fred Dello Russo]: No city-owned or private utilities or other structures are adversely impacted.

[Fred Dello Russo]: National grid shall ensure that all sewer, water, and drain lines are marked prior to any excavation.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Any disturbed concrete sidewalk panels shall be replaced in kind.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Asphalt must be replaced by asphalt.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Before beginning work, the contractor shall notify dig safe and shall obtain applicable permits from the engineering division.

[Fred Dello Russo]: National grid contractor shall utilize City of Medford regulations and standards, as well as for removing all debris related to its work.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Approved, Superintendent of Wires.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Call 781-393-2425 for any accommodations, et cetera.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Sincerely, Edward P. Finn, City Clerk.

[Fred Dello Russo]: I declare the public

[Fred Dello Russo]: public hearing open and open it up to all those in favor.

[Fred Dello Russo]: All those in favor, make yourself present and known.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Sir, state your name and address for the record.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Tim Liefert, 170 Medford Street, Malden, Massachusetts, National Grid Electric.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Thank you.

[Fred Dello Russo]: You're in favor of this.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Very good.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Anybody else in favor?

[Fred Dello Russo]: All those in favor, please present themselves to the podium.

[Fred Dello Russo]: 15-488, location of poles, attachments of fixtures in underground conduits.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Medford, Massachusetts City Clerk's Office.

[Fred Dello Russo]: You are hereby notified that, by order of the Medford City Council, a public hearing will be given at the Howard F. Walton Memorial Auditorium, 85 George P. Hassett Drive, City Hall, Medford, Massachusetts, at 7 p.m.

[Fred Dello Russo]: on Tuesday, May 26, 2015, on a petition by National Grid of North Andover, Massachusetts, and Verizon New England for permission to locate poles, wires, and fixtures, including the necessary sustaining and protecting fixtures

[Fred Dello Russo]: along and across the following public way.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Riverside Ave, National Grid to relocate one jail pole.

[Fred Dello Russo]: National Grid proposes to relocate pole 1649 Riverside Avenue, 20 feet plus or minus northwest of existing location and install a 10 feet plus or minus of two to four primary inch primary duct across public property onto

[Fred Dello Russo]: 491 Riverside Avenue property for new service.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Wherefore it prays that after due notice and hearing as provided by law, it be given permission to excavate the public highways and to run and maintain underground electrical conduits together with such sustaining and protecting fixtures as it may find necessary for the transmission of electricity.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Set underground conduits to be located substantially in accordance

[Fred Dello Russo]: with the plan filed herewith marked National Grid, Riverside Ave, Medford, Massachusetts, number 18349215, April 15th, 2015.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Approved, City Engineer.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Upon review of this petition, this work of moving the existing pole and underground conduit can proceed forthwith, provided the following requirements are met.

[Fred Dello Russo]: No city owned or private utilities or other structures are adversely impacted.

[Fred Dello Russo]: National Grid shall ensure that all sewer, water and drain lines are marked prior to any excavation.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Any disturbed concrete sidewalk panels shall be replaced in kind.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Asphalt must be replaced by asphalt.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Before beginning work, the contractor shall notify DigSafe

[Fred Dello Russo]: and shall obtain applicable permits from the engineering division.

[Fred Dello Russo]: National grid contractors shall utilize City of Medford regulations and standards as well as for removing all debris related to its work.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Approved, Superintendent of Wires.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Call 781-393-2425 for any accommodations, et cetera.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Sincerely, Edward P. Finn, City Clerk.

[Fred Dello Russo]: I declare the public hearing open and open it up to all those in favor.

[Fred Dello Russo]: All those in favor, make yourself present and known.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Sir, state your name and address for the record.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Tim Liefert, 170 Medford Street, Malden, Massachusetts, National Grid Electric.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Thank you.

[Fred Dello Russo]: You're in favor of this.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Very good.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Anybody else in favor?

[Fred Dello Russo]: All those in favor, please present themselves to the podium.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Hearing and seeing none else, I declare this portion of the meeting closed.

[Fred Dello Russo]: All those in opposition, anybody in opposition to this presented to us, please make yourself known before the podium.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Hearing and seeing none, we declare the public hearing closed and we open up the floor to recommendation.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Councilor Penta.

[Fred Dello Russo]: So on the motion of Council Penta, that the word utilize be stricken and the words adhere to all.

[Fred Dello Russo]: We are now going to amend that according to Councilor Penta to say national grid contractor shall adhere to all city of Medford regulations and standards as well as it seems as though something's missing from there.

[Fred Dello Russo]: for removing all debris related to its work.

[Fred Dello Russo]: City engineers report.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Very good.

[Fred Dello Russo]: That's Friday, May 29th,

[Fred Dello Russo]: at 9 a.m.

[Fred Dello Russo]: in the Immaculate Conception Church, 60 Pleasant Street, Route 60, at the Malden-Medford line.

[Fred Dello Russo]: This mass is offered in memoriam of deceased former members of the Medford Police Department.

[Fred Dello Russo]: They include Robert B. Corrado, Kenneth J. Hickey, Adrian L. Jean, Peter W. McGaffigan, Jr., Christopher E. Sano, Thomas J. Walsh, and Sheila Ritchie, former traffic supervisor.

[Fred Dello Russo]: The Right Reverend Robert Casey, chaplain,

[Fred Dello Russo]: to the Metro Police Department will be the principal celebrant, and current celebrants will include Father Francis Garrity, retired chaplain, and Deacon Mark Rumley of Immaculate Conception Parish.

[Fred Dello Russo]: On the motion of Councilor Camuso to take items out of order, petitions, all those in favor?

[Fred Dello Russo]: All those opposed?

[Fred Dello Russo]: To take petitions, presentations, and similar matters.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Petition by 15488, petition by Eversource Energy to address City Council on a brief presentation on Mystic Station 250 to Woburn Station number 221, KV transmission line project, questions and answers.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Folks, please come forward from Eversource.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Folks, just so you know, we discussed this through Councilor Marks last week.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Before Councilor Marks had an opportunity to address the matter with us, I had received a communication from Mr. Zamparelli of Eversource to address the council.

[Fred Dello Russo]: And so I asked him to place a petition before us.

[Fred Dello Russo]: And he has done so, so they're here to do this.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Also, I should have announced at the beginning of this meeting, and I apologize, we are not broadcasting on Comcast right now.

[Fred Dello Russo]: We are, however, broadcasting on Fios.

[Fred Dello Russo]: A request for work to repair the matter has been submitted to Comcast, and they need to get out here.

[Fred Dello Russo]: I suppose, as we all know, waiting for the cable guy can be a challenge at times.

[Fred Dello Russo]: So it is being recorded for rebroadcast.

[Fred Dello Russo]: and it is broadcasting on the Fios channel.

[Fred Dello Russo]: So please state your name and address for the record.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Great.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Well, if you could just give us a brief presentation on the project.

[Fred Dello Russo]: make those questions known to you so we can address them once you've made your preliminary presentation.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Thank you.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Yes, and the clerk is taking those down to make those part of a ongoing resolution.

[Fred Dello Russo]: If I may, from the chair, there's an extensive ongoing construction project going on now in the Winthrop Street area between Mystic Valley Parkway.

[Fred Dello Russo]: You may have seen it in some of your preliminary work.

[Fred Dello Russo]: They've run into a lot of obstacles there with relation to

[Fred Dello Russo]: It's also been a tremendous burden on the community and people who traverse that area, both local people and just people who make their way periodically through Metfit.

[Fred Dello Russo]: It's been impactful and it's gone on a long time.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Although it's going to result in a great improvement on the aggressive wastewater and runoff, nonetheless,

[Fred Dello Russo]: the impact of the project has been hard on people.

[Fred Dello Russo]: My sense is that you're going through that neck of the woods, which will perhaps be repaved and pristine once you start digging again, and that's gonna be a tremendous concern for people.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Can you address that at all for us?

[Fred Dello Russo]: Well, thank you, thank you.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Madam Vice President.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Thank you, Madam Vice President.

[Fred Dello Russo]: 15483, communication from the Mayor to the Honorable President and members of the Medford City Council.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Dear Mr. President and Councilors, I respectfully request and recommend that your Honorable Body approve of the following amendment to revised ordinances entitled, Compensation Plan and Leave Ordinances, Chapter 66, Personnel.

[Fred Dello Russo]: City of Medford amendment to revised ordinances, Compensation Plan and Leave Ordinances.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Chapter 66, personnel be it ordained by the City Council of the City of Medford in Chapter 66, entitled Personnel.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Article 2, entitled Classification and Compensation Plans, Section 66.40, entitled Public Safety Personnel, is hereby amended by adding the following.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Grade PS1A, title Student Officer, Step 1, $40,000 effective upon passage.

[Fred Dello Russo]: The purpose of this ordinance change is to create a new classification for candidates attending the police academy.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Upon graduation of approved police academies, the student officer will have successfully completed the prescribed course of study for basic police training.

[Fred Dello Russo]: and to exercise police powers as mandated by Massachusetts General Laws, Chapter 41, Section 96B.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Very truly yours, Michael J. McGlynn, Mayor.

[Fred Dello Russo]: and the possibility that people of moderate to low income will find it difficult to live in that neighborhood, those people who are most in need of use of public transportation.

[Fred Dello Russo]: And I know that we have to be clear to it and clear about it before we do that.

[Fred Dello Russo]: This award is in recognition of Mr. Mastercuse's American service during France's liberation during World War II at the invasion of Normandy.

[Fred Dello Russo]: This honor places another wonderful distinction for the city of Medford and our veterans who so bravely defended freedom wherever the call.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Thank you.

[Fred Dello Russo]: It was 70 years ago that the Allied forces finally conquered evil in Europe, and people from Medford and all over the United States stepped up to the plate

[Fred Dello Russo]: Rich and poor alike, they came from every walk of life, very much unlike what we see today.

[Fred Dello Russo]: And it was just a remarkable thing.

[Fred Dello Russo]: also has the additional burden of finding a way to deal with this, get the graffiti cleaned up.

[Fred Dello Russo]: all the bond indebtedness that we had, but it rolled out 30 years, and it showed us when something was going to end.

[Fred Dello Russo]: And then some smaller, bigger items, like every time we have to drop several hundred thousand dollars on a new fire truck, things that we'd bond maybe for a shorter term.

[Fred Dello Russo]: And I'd really like to see where we are with that before we get too far in something that maybe more than one of us will find disagreeable.

[Fred Dello Russo]: I think Councilor Lungo-Koehn is right in asking for this update as soon as possible.

[Fred Dello Russo]: We do have aspects of the pool that are time sensitive, and I know access issues are very important to an awful lot of us, but that doesn't mean we can't proceed while examining, straightening that out.

[Fred Dello Russo]: So I'm grateful for all of that, and I hope that we can make progress on this, Mr. President.

[Fred Dello Russo]: If I could, through the chair, Ms.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Rosen,

[Fred Dello Russo]: So you pointed out a way of presenting budget and analyzing how each department finishes out each year, how it spent its money.

[Fred Dello Russo]: And oftentimes when we get to the end of the year, we do so without doing so in that, you know,

[Fred Dello Russo]: Department X has $30,000 left over that it didn't spend, and it's the last week in June.

[Fred Dello Russo]: So we're going to take that money and throw it into Department Y, who overspent $60,000, and hope let's try to find the other 30 somewhere.

[Fred Dello Russo]: Vis-a-vis the whole capital improvement program, which I think is built into our budget as far as our indebtedness,

[Fred Dello Russo]: throughout the S.Y.

[Fred Dello Russo]: debt service each year is budgeted, because we know that's going to be what it is.

[Fred Dello Russo]: How do you think we can then better improve the budget process?

[Fred Dello Russo]: So starting out with the budget, because I sit on a board for the non-profit, and when we go through our annual budget, we do a projection that we know we're going to have this to work with, X. And then we build to that goal.

[Fred Dello Russo]: And part of that goal in the non-profit is an aspect of fundraising for operations.

[Fred Dello Russo]: But nonetheless, we meet that.

[Fred Dello Russo]: And I think I've often thought that that might be a more helpful way of doing what we do here, though it's tough because there's so much unknown.

[Fred Dello Russo]: However, I think that sort of a, and we had talked about this as a group, and I'm sure you remember as far as when we've, several years ago, when we got up to the point of this capital improvement program,

[Fred Dello Russo]: that as a council we had envisioned a visioning process that would be collaborative and something that would have open communication, clarity in goals that we then come to agreement on and reach.

[Fred Dello Russo]: I think to a degree, we did that without going through that process, because the way government communicates in Medford isn't what one may describe as healthy.

[Fred Dello Russo]: But we're doing that.

[Fred Dello Russo]: And I think what you're trying to say, or what you are saying, is, well, then let's do that in a healthy, transparent way.

[Fred Dello Russo]: involves participation.
